Posts.Content: lynnjay wrote: Don't know if I am posting in the right board or not but here it goes.  My first excisional biopsy revealed an atypical intraductal papilloma.  Subsequent MRI showed more (about 4) small suspicious spots.  I was considered high risk and put on tamoxifen.  Follow up MRI came four months later.  The follow up MRI showed no change and a MRI guided core needle biopsy is scheduled for 8/5/08.  They will try to sample at least one if not more of the spots.  I'm a little worried about the fact that there are 4 spots and they are in different parts of my breast (right breast).  If the biopsy shows cancer or even more atypical cells can they do an excisional biopsy just on the four spots?  What should I expect from the MRI guided core needle biopsy?  I'd appreciate any advice/experiences that you can share.  I have been "lurking" around this website for a while and feel I know about half of you. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: atypical papilloma lynnjay nowheregirl

Posts.Content: Jul 27, 2008 06:18PM lynnjay wrote: Thanks for your reply, Leaf.  I keep thinking they are gonna want to "take it all".  I'm not a very big girl.  Do you need to take any time off from work after a MRI guided core needle biopsy?  I'm guessing maybe day of bx and one day after.  They said they would sedate me with twilight zone medication.  They also said something about a titanium marker.  What are the usual reasons for that?
Posts.Title: atypical papilloma lynnjay nowheregirl
